Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: disney27
Reviews.Content: My experience with the Hotel du Printemps was good overall. It was a little bit of a pain getting there from the airport-the train/metro stations have a lot of stairs and it was difficult with luggage, and a car to the airport which we used to go back was pretty pricey. The proximity to the Nation metro station was convenient, because one of the lines from that station goes to most of the major tourist spots. Check-in was convenient and the staff was friendly; when we had a problem with our safe, someone came up immediately to fix it. The room was small but not uncomfortably so, and everything was clean and new-looking. Breakfast was good but not worth the price as there wasn't a lot of variety; I'm sure you could get more for your money elsewhere, but for convenience's sake it was good enough. However, in our third floor room we did hear noise from the metro underneath. It was not loud enough to bother me, but I can only imagine that it would be louder in the rooms on lower floors. The other problem I had was that although it is a non-smoking hotel, people were clearly disregarding this rule and smoking anyway. My allergies were absolutely horrible all through the night due to the smoky smell and it's something that the hotel staff needs to get on top of. However, it was overall a good stay and a good price-just take care of the smoking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean, newly renovated hotel, great value, close to metro”
Reviews.Author: LTT63
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip Advisor and was very pleased. Room was small but exactly as pictured. Newly decorated. The entire hotel seemed to be recently renovated. Perfect for sleeping in, which was only time we were there. Very clean, especially the bathroom . Flat screen TV in room...only two channels in English, CNN and BBC. Safe in closet. Breakfast was OK, some pastries, coffee, cereal, yogurt, eggs and juice. Elevator and cute courtyard. Very nice lobby with computer. Property is non smoking but someone on our floor smoked during our stay and we woke up from smell during night. The hallway was very smokey smelling as well. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Great pastry shop out the door and to the right. Only negative..we asked for a car to airport and was told cost would be 50 euros at MOST if we hit traffic but would probably be less. Well, we made great time and the driver wanted 57 euros, which annoyed me a bit. So price around in advance if you need ride to airport. We would have taken metro but it was very early and we were nervous. Would stay here again. Quiet and safe area, close to the action, yet far enough away at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there twice before, going back again!”
Reviews.Author: LostinTransit10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not super close in. It is about a ten minute walk from the the nearest Metro stop. The front desk staff was over the top friendly and help. One gal even went to the post office for us and mailed an oversize letter for us. They all spoke good to excellent english. On our first stay, we had two types of rooms: a room with three beds, which my two boys and I used, and a second room with two beds for my wife and daughter. The three bedroom room was big enough. The two bedroom room was very small. My second stay included a one bedroom room (super small, ie. New York City small) and a two bedroom room. All of the rooms were very clean. There is a bit of noise from the street at times, but the area becomes very quiet later at night. The Wi-Fi in the rooms was weak, but did work. There was a PC in the lobby that we also used. We had no problem getting the few minutes time we needed on it. The optional breakfast was fine - a tad more than I normally spend - but then it is Paris and other than going to McDonalds, there are not a whole lot of other low cost choices in the morning. Just reserved a room for my next trip. The room prices in the past and for the next trip are, in my mind, a screaming bargain for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: NataljaR
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying in this hotel. Nice and friendly staff, clean and just recently renovated rooms with stylish interior, organic bathroom products and free wi-fi in the room. The location is good, as there are 2 stations around just 2-3 minutes away. Nothing much to do in the neighborhood, but you can definitely find some cafes, mid range restaurants, wine shop and bakeries around. I would recomend this place for business travelers, families and also couples, who search best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: alissa2128
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our European trip in July '11 for four nights. We booked it based on the reviews we read on here, and we were so glad that we did. We had a fantastic stay. While it is not located in the heart of the city, it is very convenient to two different metro locations- Picpus right across the street, and Nation about 5-7 minutes away. Upon check-in, the staff was very friendly and accomodating. We arrived early, and they were just finishing cleaning our room. They allowed us to check in and put our things in the room as soon as it was cleaned. The room itself was great- very modern and updated, and very clean (as is the rest of the hotel.) I personally really liked the fact that the rooms have wood floors (or faux wood) and not carpet, makes it feel much cleaner! The rooms are small, but standard for Europe. We did eat breakfast here a few of the days. It seemed on the priceier side, but they did have fresh eggs. They also had cereal, and of course pastries. We enjoyed the breakfast and the fact that it was convenient, but you may get more for your money just going to one of the little pastry shops around the area--which we did a couple of times as well. There is a grocery store in the area, and one night we decided to grab some cheese and wine and enjoy it at the hotel. Staff was very helpful and got us two wine glasses and a corkscrew, and we enjoyed it out on the little patio in the center of the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel. If you are looking to be close to the action of Paris, this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for something that feels like a 4-star hotel for a 2-star price, and are willing to hop on the Metro to get to where you want to go, then this is definitely the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal launchpad for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1stClassLounge
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an affordable and conveniently located place to stay in Paris, this is it. My room was very nice, it looked completely newly renovated and the furnishings were contemporary and stylish. Organic bath products in the bathroom were a nice touch. Free Wi-Fi, something so important for business travellers, worked perfectly which was essential for me on this trip. Just across the street you have the Metro line 6, and if you walk 5 minutes you have another Metro stop with more choice of lines to take. The area around the hotel is quiet, charming, and not infested with tourists, with several nice bars and restaurants. My only complaints about this hotel are very minor. I am a veteran of the European hotel breakfast, and Hotel du Printemps' breakfast is one of the more basic I've seen. Save your 8 Euros and walk to a boulangerie. My room was cleaned well, however my drinking glass and my bath products were not replaced, however if this caused an issue I'm sure the friendly front desk staff would have sorted it for me in a second. I'll definitely use this lovely hotel again on my next business trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, great service, lovely styling!!!”
Reviews.Author: AleExplorer
Reviews.Content: What a super hotel this is! Very modern in it's presentation and very comfortable. Only stayed for one night but we thoroughly enjoyed the Hotel du Printemps. It's located close to Picpus metro station (2 minutes walk), but Nation is also nearby. There are a number of shops in the hotel's vicinity (patisseries, a supermarket, fromagerie) and several small bars and restaurants. We arrived before the usual check-in time at the hotel, but that didn't matter. We were received very well by the friendly and very professional young gentleman on reception. A great start. Despite our early arrival, our room was ready so we went straight up. We were very impressed. The room was small (typical of Paris hotels) and more long than wide. The high ceilings made the room feel bigger than it was. Decor-wise it was smart with neutral, earthy colours. There was a flat-screen TV and the room was exceptionally clean. The same could be said for the en-suite. Wi-fi was available and there was a PC in reception that we could use free-of-charge. After settling in we headed out to explore the nearby surroundings. A good idea as we found a cracking food market along the Cours de Vincennes selling fruit, vegetables, fish and hot and cold food amongst other things. The following day there was an antiques/flea market. This experience confirmed that we had chosen a good area to stay in, despite it being a little further away from the main sights of the city. That said, the transport system whisked us into the centre in 10 minutes (TIP: buy a Paris Visite travel card - more expensive than other European city travel cards, but still good value). I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's small but very well formed with great staff and a really homely feel to it. Get it booked!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than 2*”
Reviews.Author: jefferson_05
Reviews.Content: Our experience of the Hotel du Printemps was very positive. We stayed four nights and throughout the service was excellent, nicely clean and tidy rooms. It is located on a very nice tree lined boulevard in a relatively quiet suburb in the east of Paris and is perfectly located within 5 mins of the Metro. Plenty of amenities close give lots of eating options.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Well”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Several years ago this hotel was a dive. Nowadays this place which has been remodeled throughout , is comfortable ,clean and everyone is happy to help with your needs.They speak several languages so never a problem communicating.Its close to several metro and rer lines.Located on a fairly calm tree line street.The price is reasonable.However the rooms tend to be small.We did enjoy the week spent here and now have it on our list of pleasant hotels

Reviews.Title: “Close to metro, nice quiet street”
Reviews.Author: KiwiJane11
Reviews.Content: The location is good, close to a couple of different metro stops. Though we did have trouble finding the right street when we arrived. We stayed in a triple room and I would recommend paying a little extra and getting that one as it was a good size, especially when you compare it to other rooms in Paris. Staff were friendly. The breakfast was alright, I would suggest skipping and trying out one of the patisseries nearby instead.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sabrina123456789
Reviews.Content: this hotel is pretty good. it was only rated a 2 star but considering some of the other '2 star' hotels we have stayed in it should probably be rated a 3. it is in a quieter neighborhood than most. it isa little out of the way, but it is about a 5 min walk from the subway. its also on the rer a line. you can take the rer b to chatelet and then transfer to the a. not the most convenient, but a huge plus that it is on an rer line and closer to a more major subway stop. we stayed there 2 separate times in 3 weeks. the second time we got the breakfast for 8 euro. for those who have not stayed in Paris it seems a little steep, but once you see the Paris prices it is SO worth it, trust me. especially for all you can eat. the rooms were clean and nice. the first room shower was super tiny. i could barely suds up. the second room was larger and the bathroom had a different layout. try to ask for room 37. all and all pretty good! oh, just be careful with the wake up calls. when we were going to catch a flight we asked for a wakeup call for 4am. it came at 420. doesnt seem like a big deal, but when you order a taxi and only have 20 mins to shower (for 2 ppl), get 2 large suitcases down and check out it?! that was the only problem we had. :D

Reviews.Title: “Verry Happy”
Reviews.Author: GypsyJean
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our 4 night stay at this beautiful hotel. We spoke little French but all the staff that we came in contact with spoke English very well and were very helpul and courteous. The hotel was very clean and our room had all new furnishings and was recently renovated. The rooms are small however those that are travelling in/around Europe will not be suprised and it is no smaller than other hotels we stayed at. The beds were comfortable and there was very little noise. We liked the free internet access in the lobby as well. On Sundays there are street stalls with good quality recycled items on the footpath straight out the front of the hotel which was a lovely suprise. For tourists, we walked to the Bastille (about 10 mins) and caught the Le Tour bus that took us to all the sights in Paris. Would stay again and would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: MortenDK14
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very close to Metro Picpus, Superior Room only 77€ (w/o breakfast) good space new bathroom, average breakfast 8€ - you may consider eating breakfast somewhere else. Not downtown, but with the metro you are there in 15 minutes. Very little noice from the metro passing under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Julian_Gralak53
Reviews.Content: We spent only 1 night in the hotel. Our room (No 3) was tiny but I know that in Paris it is hard to find anything bigger for reasonable price. Hotel is situated in the quiet street off Place de Nation just between two metro stations: La Nation et Picpus (La Nation is much bigger station with several lines). Location of the hotel is great for nice walks even to Louvre, Notre Dame etc. Our room was relatively quiet with not disturbing noise and vibration from the metro but a very disturbing noise from other rooms. The room was renovated not a long time ago so it was clean except the window frame in the toilet (they forgot to renovate?) Wi-fi is only available in the lobby. After reading some reviews I expected something better, but for 1 night it is generally OK.

Reviews.Title: “Small lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilQ
Reviews.Content: I might not choose this hotel again during next trip to Paris. The hotel is 5 minutes walk to the subway station but is still far away from many touristic places. The hotel manager is very kind and gave me a lot of help in finding it. But most of the staffs are not as professional as he is.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay”
Reviews.Author: Love T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel was ok, the carpets in the hallway where dirty which wasn't a nice welcome as you walked to your room. The room we stayed in was really tiny with 2 twin beds. There was some kind of stains on our sheets which wasn't very comforting. There was no safe in the room so had to leave valuables in our friends safe that was an "upgraded" room. It was close to a metro stop which was good. All in all I didn't find the price of the hotel to be worth what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: zara2
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for four nights in Paris on advice from a friend who had stayed here the year before. We were not disappointed. The hotel has been beautifully renovated and is in a lovely, quiet and peaceful area of Paris. It is close to Nation and Picpus metro station, with grocery stores around as well as fabulous bakeries. Originally we booked a double room with a double bed but when we arrived with all our luggage I decided that the bed and physical space in the room was a little too small for both of us so we upgraded for an extra 32 euro for four nights to a room with two single beds. In this room we could both comfortably fit our suitcases and we pushed the two separate beds together to make one. This room then became very cosy for us and we were able to have a great night’s sleep. I also loved that you could open the windows for some fresh air and there was no noise outside. The reception staff provided excellent service and I was very impressed with the free internet wireless access in the hotel. Some of the other reviews commented on the fact that this hotel was not very central, to that comment I would add -nothing in Paris is central. I have been to Paris four times and it truly is a very large city. You just need to decide what you prefer to be located close to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: shakescene
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while visiting Paris. It was very clean, bright, and well appointed. The staff was very friendly and spoke English. The location was within a short walk from 2 metro stations (one is an RER). For the price, location, and satisfaction, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: happycampet
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights and could not fault a single thing! From the minute we checked in to when we checked out the staff could not do enough for us. They spoke very good English and were always available to help with any questions. We did pay another 4 euros each to upgrade to a bigger room which was definitely worth it (we booked the room through the hotels official web site). The room itself was perfect for a short city break. The room was immaculate and very well furnished and the bathroom was lovely and clean which was very much appreciated after a long day/evening's walk around the beautiful city of Paris. The breakfast was nice, typical continental breakfast really which we paid for on the day(8 euros each) instead of when booking the hotel room as on our 2nd morning we wanted to try a local cafe or bakery for breakfast. There are plenty of places to eat in the gorgeous quiet area that the hotel is located, 1 of which where we had a lovely evening meal is called "cafe cosy" which is located about 200 yards on your left as you leave the hotel. The hotel is only about 15 mins metro journey from the Gare du Nord train station and is also on the same metro line as the Eiffel Tower. As our title says we will definitely stay in this hotel again when we return to Paris, I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT! will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: hksince2002
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel which i fell in love with. Amazing in every way. The staff was super-helpful and friendly. Breakfast was served but we did not have any. The rooms were small but very clean and quiet. The bathrooms were so clean, they felt as though they were brand new. The beds were soft and the air-conditioning worked well. The shower stall area felt tiny but the high levels of cleanliness made up for it. The train station was a two minute walk away and the neighbourhood is a quiet one. Make sure you have/print a map of the hotel as some taxi drivers cant find it on their own.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nnhpq
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and stayed here for 8 days in July. The triple room was lovely, the staff were friendly and the location was very close to the Metro. the only negative was that the floor in the room was slanted, and I felt like I was going to fall out of bed every night. The bathrooms are a little small, but that is to be expected in a European hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Paris but doesn't want to pay too much for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Clean”
Reviews.Author: SEASHELL18
Reviews.Content: We (my sister and I) had a 3 nights stay over in this hotel in Paris after our 10 days trip from Provence and 3 days trip from Chamonix. Its far from city, 10-15 mins away to Eiffel Tower, The Lourve, Champs Elysee, etc. But it was a cozy neighbourhood, 5mins walk to Metro Station. No noise at night! With free WiFi facility, great to connect to your family and friends! There is a bakery nearby, and a few chinese restaurants around there. Small basic room, beds are small/narrow (its small for asian, how abt for european? :) haha) its soft.. Overall, the room is value for money. :) SP Chong (Malaysia)

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: travertine6
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location. It's far away from the touristy things and in an authentic neighborhood. Nation metro is a 5 minute walk away - it is a main station that connects with many lines. The room was super clean, newly renovated, although it was small and awkwardly laid out. Quiet,, aircon worked, internet worked. If the euro stays so expensive relative to the dollar, I'd go again! Otherwise, I'd upgrade to a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but cozy”
Reviews.Author: sbomber51
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel is very nice and helpful. It is very clean and modern. The rooms are a little small, but so are all in europe. Beds were a little hard. Close to subway and many cafes. Also grocery store and laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaquelPonsati
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone to Paris and this is really a ery good hotel! Room was quite small, but very nice, clean, confortable and well decorated, I loved it! Very close to Place de la Nation and the metro! Staff was very friendly too, I hardly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those watching their $'s”
Reviews.Author: shaste80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights recently on a solo trip to Paris… The location is great, it’s in a residential area as stated elsewhere with plenty of dining options and close to 2 metro stations. The 6 line located at the closer station, Picpus, is the one I used on my last day to catch the Air France shuttle back to CDG. Upon entering the hotel I was surprised by how fresh the place looked. Check-in was super simple and there’s free Wi-Fi throughout the entire hotel. You do however need to create an account with the service provider… I booked a single room which was a very clean but small room with a double bed and one tiny nightstand as well as a table w/ bench & a wardrobe. The bathroom is tiny, so tiny that if you are at the toilet your legs are under the sink…lol. My only issue with my stay is that the shower is curtained and because the shower is very small it will often touch you as you shower… I hope they consider changing to folding doors. Overall I really liked this place and at such a great price point I plan to stay here again when I return in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Paris Hotel. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: babyaisiebarb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on my way through Paris to fly back home. Convenient to Gare de Lyon and metro system. Closest metro station is Picpus which runs through to major sites. As a solo traveller booked single room. Tidy space and typically small for Paris. Small entry lobby that doubled as hanging and storage space.Single bed, 2 side tables. Small but functional bathroom. Shower is indeed small but even as a largish person was able to get to all the right places in the confied space (due to good shower head and pressure). The entire hotel looks very new and well styled. All staff were more than helpful and all had very good English. The hotel is convenient to some good local restaurants, bakeries and the Printemps Department store. If you don't feel the need to stay right next to the tourists sites and monuments (although the hotel is not far from Bastille), then I highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: Advisortip
Reviews.Content: First, thank you Colette, Claudia and all staffs for the wonderful stay and excellent services. I booked the hotel online with a non-refundable condition, after 2 weeks, I realized I made a mistake and call them. They re-arrange my booking without penalty and accomodate me accordingly, and I truly appreicate that. I booked the superior double and triple. Rooms are very comfortable, big in Europe standard, spotlessly clean, and all furnitures are decorated nicely. The hotel is near Picpus metro (5 mns) more than Nation (10 mns), however, Nation is a hub of diff metro and train lines which will bring you to most part of town. There are restaurants near both metro, Dalou is our favorite near Nation, try their bavette and duck, really good. Casino supermkt is just outside Nation metro (exit Ave du Trone). A block from the hotel near Picpus metro, you will find small shops, pastry , cheese, wine... very residential feel and charming. Breakfast is 8 Euro which has poached eggs, ham, croissant... a good start for the day. Option is grab a croissant (1 euro) in the pastry shop next door, who can resist french criossant. Taxi from airport (CDG) to the hotel is between 50 - 70 Euro, and 25 Euro from Orly. You can negotiate with the driver to have a fix price rather than using the meter on rush hour, traffic can be very bad so it adds up with meter, it is around 20 - 30 mns drive without traffic, but can be approx 1 hr min during rush hour. If you plan to take the train and metro, it will cost approx 10Euro per person to the hotel from CDG, suggest you to think twice, because you need to transfer, stairs, small corridors, and long walk. If you are a group, go for the taxi. My family had a wonderful stay in this hotel, feels like coming home after a long day. All staff are honest and great people, gave us info when we needed, keeping our passport during our stay. I was surprised they stayed 2 stars, to me, it is a high 3 1/2. Strongly recommend, and will defintely come back next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Modern air conditioned hotel in quiet part of Paris nearby Metro”
Reviews.Author: peyter
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here during summer 2011, the air conditioning was a welcome respite from the heat. Rooms are very modern, and large for the price. Location is great, nearby the Metro. Can be hard to find though . Once you leave the Metro , look for a Casion supermaket/grocery store on your right hand side. Subsequently look for the HSBC bank, the hotel is on the next street to the bank. Bring the address along and the locals can point the way for you. There's a Printemps shopping centre near the hotel, you can get most of your Paris shopping done there save for LV.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: artisticlcy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in a superior room as there was not much difference in price when we booked. I expected it to be small given some of the reviews but the room was a comfortable size, I can't speak for the size of the standard rooms. There was a nice dresser and desk in the room and still enough space to open a fairly large suitcase. The decor was calming and everything seemed new and clean. The staff were pleasant and spoke english. It was nice that they had a computer with internet for guests to use. We decided not to have breakfast there as I don't eat much in the morning; we went to Cafe Cosy down the road for a pastry and coffee (costing only a few euros). The Nation metro stop is so close and that line will take you directly to the Louvre in about 15 minutes. There is also a supermarket next to the metro stop, convenient for drinks and snacks. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Ipod stolen but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmarkow4
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is very nice and helpful. While the rooms are small, they have a lovely outside patio where you can sit and drink coffee or wine. The location is not suburb if you like walking to all the sights, BUT it is wonderfully situated near the metro. The nearest metro station is only about 3 minutes walk (picpus) and the larger station (Nation) is only about 6 minutes walking. You can get anywhere in the city from these two lines. Unfortunately, my ipod was stolen the second day. I took all my valuables EXCEPT the stinking ipod, which I placed inside my backpack. When we returned that day, the ipod was gone. My family believed I simply misplaced it and I conceded this could be true (though I remember putting it my backpack) because I didn't want the first full day of our vacation spoiled. Luckily, the ipod was 3 years old. But still, watch out for valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: peachsorbet
Reviews.Content: Our room had 2 adults and a 4 yr old sharing a bed. We had informed the hotel in advance of our arrangement and they were very kind to let us have the room on the ground floor (room #1). Being the ground floor room, we didn't get a street view of the lovely parisian buildings. But we did get a nice view of the backyard which had a couple of garden tables and chairs. The housekeeper's laundry and linen rooms were there as well. It felt like a personal backyard as no one really went there. This room was a large room that was handicap-friendly. Even the bathroom was huge. There was a fold-up seat at the shower even! Only draw back that there was no shower curtain, hence the shower area was very exposed. This meant it felt very chilly immediately after you turned off the shower (water was hot!) and the water got everywhere. Internet connection was not that strong and there was the hassle of setting up an account to access the free wifi. Otherwise, there was a computer with a printer on the ground floor. They'd give you the first 4 sheets of paper free and you'd have to pay if you want more. Breakfast was an additional 8euros but we opted to buy from the nearby pattisier/boulangerie just at the end of the street which we ate in the room or in the little backyard just next to the room. You'd be spoilt for choice... We had croissants, pain au chocolat, brioches, madeleines for breakfast. Location - about 5 - 10 minutes walking distance to Nation (when walking with a child). It's not centrally located but as other reviewers mentioned, there are many lines connecting there which helps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cachi_man
Reviews.Content: My parents and I were very pleased with this choice. The hotel is excellent. Very nice location, 100 meters away from Picpus metro station or 5 minutes from Nation station with metro and RER lines stops. The hotel was clean, modern. The staff was really helpful and very very kind. And excellent choice at a very good price for your stay in Paris. Some restaurants in the surroundings or if you are on a budget, there's a Casino market near the Nation station. Overall, an excellent choice, I would recommend it to anyone. Small suggestion: Put a small fridge in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: mixedlollies
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a hostel for the two days before I stayed here, so perhaps my review is a bit biased. I do have to say I loved the hotel. Its was very clean. It was quiet. It was very modern and everything was decorated tastefully and neutrally. There is air con which came in handy as the days I was in Paris it was late 20s. I was surprised that it was a 2 star. I would have thought it would be 3. But I think that's a good thing as you would be charged 2 star prices. The location is probably the only draw back to this hotel. It is within easy reach of Nation and Picpus but you do notice that you have to travel a bit further. It's okay as it is a well services metro. If you are looking for a nice, clean, comfortable hotel and don't mind that it is not say near the Louvre, then I would definitely stay here. I will be coming back here from now on I think. Oh I can only say hello and do you speak in English in French, so it was great they were English speakers. You can also leave your luggage there if you arrive early and there is a lift.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: philfromdenver
Reviews.Content: Very small room but clean. Staff very helpful (Thanks Claudia and Saiid). Location excellent. Great neighborhood feel. Don't miss the farmer's market at the end of the block on Saturdays until 1pm. Metro access and restaurants are easy to walk to. A fine buy for this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Solstice7
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine why this hotel isn't more highly ranked! It's location in the 12e may not be the most central, but Nation (one of the Metro stations a 5 minute walk away) is barely 2 RER stops from everything else in the centre of Paris, and I've heard worst reviews of the accommodation options offered in the centre, for thrice the price! Hotel du Printemps is PERFECT. Great location (near the metro, around the corner from restaurants, bakeries, small supermarkets, in a safe neighbourhood with sprawling wide pavements and lush greenery), tastefully (and what looked like newly) decorated, and extremely clean. It's rooms are on the small side, but which rooms aren't in Paris? Besides, how much time DO you need to spend in the room when there's so much to see and do in Paris?? The room had fresh sheets and towels, an incredibly clean bathroom, soft comfy beds. We had a room facing the street but because it was a quiet residential area, noise was never an issue. Reception service could be patchy depending on who was manning it (we found that the male receptionists tended to be friendlier) but all in all, service was adequate and the price really was uncomparable. We'd toyed with staying at Hotel Des Arts in Montmatre before booking Hotel Du Printemps, and having visited Montmatre and seeing how des Arts was located on a steep slope and far from the metro made us incredibly thankful we'd picked Hotel Du Printemps instead! Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean new rooms, convenient but a bit far from center”
Reviews.Author: bankergirl1016
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling on a budget and would not compromise cleanliness and quality of the hotel, this is the place for you. A bit off the beaten track, and the metro is not that near to the hotel (5 min walk) but nation is an okay residential area so I dont mind the walking. Great patisserie a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: matti70
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and myself took a triple room with bathroom ensuite. The room was spacious even for three and although the quality of the furniture is nothing to write home about, it was very adequate for our needs. The room was always cleaned thoroughly. A good breakfast is served in the lobby with most tables next to a large window so you can watch parisians going about their businessin the tree-lined boulevard. A very useful Internet-connected PC is free for residents to use in the lobby, albeit with a awkward French keyboard. Location is close to the Picpus Metro station and you can very easily use a combination of bus / metro to get there. It is a quite pleasant location and there are some good restaurants, patissieres and a mini-market within walking distance. We would gladly book this hotel again for our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “No need to stay in central Paris with this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dewjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights in Paris, and the Hotel Du Printemps was a great place to stay. We were only a 10-15 minute Metro ride from all of the Paris sites. It was also easy to get to the train stations for day trips to Reims, Giverny and Versailles. Why pay twice as much or more for the "convenience" of being in the middle of Paris. The staff were all very courteous and helpful, and the updated room (twin superior) was big enough for the two of us..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: Werbrichfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Easter weekend. We did enjoy our stay. The room we had was smal, but I wasn't surprised as I had read the other comments on this hotel. But after exploring Paris, we really only went immediately to bed upon our return. The street that this hotel was located was very "neighborhood-like". it didn't feel like we were at a hotel. We enjoyed exploring the neighborhood around the hotel. There was a flea market a couple of streets over and we liked walking through that as well as some of the other shops and eateries close by. The bakery on the corner is very good. We chose to eat in the hotel as the food was Ok and we could just sit and plan our day. Yes, the elevator is small as is the shower, but we didn't mind that so much. The staff was very friendly to us during our entire stay. They were doing some electrical wiring in the halls when we arrived, but were polite and gracious to us too. We would stay here again upon returning to Paris The only issue we had was the directions from the "Nation" Metro stop. We asked people where the street was, including some parking police and no one knew. After spending about 1/2 hour walking around the traffic circle, we finally found it. If we had used the Picpus Metro stop, we would have been about 100 yards from the hotel's door. I think directions from that stop would be better. We used the Metro so much in the 3 days in Paris, it was extremely convienent having the Metro stop so close-by

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: auspejo
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel. My partner and I stayed here for five nights, and then another two nights on our way back from London so we stayed in two different rooms, number 11 and 14 I believe. One was larger than the other, the first one being quite small.However, it is uncommon to get larger rooms in Paris. The rooms were both very comfortable, the decor was pleasant - very Parisian. The staff were friendly. There is a fantastic little bakery at the end of the street where we got a delicious breakfast every morning for just 3 euros. It's right near a metro station which is very convenient and the neighbourhood is friendly and very quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: carlos151
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel in a calm and peaceful area of Paris. Although it is not in a particularly touristy area of Paris this is an advantage as it allows visitors to escape from the bustle of the tourist sites to a more authentic area of Paris where mainly locals live. The main sites of Paris are easily accessible from the metro close by. The rooms are well decorated, clean and modern. While the rooms are smaller than many travelers will be used to, they are very comfortable and have all necessary amenities. The reception staff are very pleasant and helpful. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, near a metro station”
Reviews.Author: gzanuz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Printems is a 2 star hotel located in the Bercy area, near the Place de la Nation. Their rooms are small, but with a renewed furniture and quite modern - definitely not tired. Sometimes we could feel the "shaking" caused by the metro trains passing, but I never missed any sleep due to that. Service is simple, do not expect too much. However, the staff was always attentive for any requests we've made. There's a simple breakfast available for extra 8 euros each person. The fact the hotel is very near a Metro station (Picpus - line 6) makes it easy to go anywhere else in Paris. Supposedly there was free wifi. However, although my laptop connected to it several times, nothing actually came through it. The hotel staff insisted that the service was functioning ok and it was probably being overloaded. I'm pretty sure it wasn't working at all. For travelers on a budget, it's an option.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small but a fantastic B&B”
Reviews.Author: mootrotter
Reviews.Content: Most hotel/B&B rooms are small in Paris and Hotel Du Printemps in no exception but the decor was lovely, staff friendly and very helpful, and the location of the hotel amazing as it was a lovely little suburb with lots of place to eat and drink but not in the main part of the City but easy access by tube to get into the heart of Paris. Very impressed with the value of this place, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you're traveling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMan42
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for the first time for 5 days, and picked this little boutique hotel based on the reviews we found here on Trip Advisor. First, let's get the basics out of the way. This is Paris: the rooms are SMALL. The bathroom is SMALL. I think we can just apply that to 90% of the hotels, unless you're dropping mega bucks, which we definitely were trying to avoid. That said, the rooms and hotel were impeccably clean. This is a family-owned hotel and the couple that run it are lovely people. Also, Mark and Claudia, who take turns running the reception desk, are very helpful with all requests and can get you anywhere you need to go. The location of the Hotel is great: 2 blocks from the NATION Metro stop, which means you can be anywhere in Paris in 15 minutes using the RER/Metro system. Highly recommended: buy a 5-day pass for 50 Euros. If I could give only one piece of advice for first timers in Paris this would be it. Taxis can be very expensive, and the metro system is very easy to use once you get the hang of it. Back to the hotel: it is situated in the Picpus neighborhood (I know, not a very appealing name), which is a very, very upscale area. Clean and quiet. The girls were delighted to find themselves surrounded by wine & cheese shops, bakeries, flower shops, etc. A very authentic French neighborhood, not "touristy" at all, but again, only two blocks from Nation and therefore 15 minutes from virtually all the most popular tourist destinations. Finally, the rooms are not very noise proof. We had a "gentlemen" next to us roll in the last two nights around 4 AM, and you could literally hear him walk across his room, take a shower, bump into furniture, etc. I would recommend asking specifically for Room # 3, due to it's location you only have one neighbor and therefore might be able to minimize the chances of having a bad one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Classy”
Reviews.Author: PedMeg
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean, modern and freshly decorated hotel. Very quiet and comfortable room. Staff were very welcoming and helpful with any questions we had. Location is good in that there are plenty of ammenities nearby, although you are on the opposite side of Paris to the Eiffel Tour, L'Arc de Triompe etc. However, the metro from Nation station will take you to these sights in 20-30mins. Internet and printer available for guest use. breakfast was a buffet style and had all the expected continental options.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: trudy2410
Reviews.Content: This lovely little hotel was all it lived up to be on the tripadvisor reviews I looked at before I booked. The location is great with a metro line close by and although the rooms are small they are clean and modern. The staff were friendly and helpful and there are shops and a supermarket close by. The breakfast at 8 euros was a little pricey but then I found the whole of Paris expensive, I nearly fell of my chair when a milkshake for my daughter cost me 7 euros in a cafe in one of the back streets. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a base for exploring Paris, as it represents great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Great Location, Wonderful House Keeping”
Reviews.Author: Harrod301
Reviews.Content: They say it's impossible to get a good hotel in Paris in a great price. It's not true if you stayed in Hotel du Printemps before. it is so near to Picpus station. Nearby are many restaurants and food. RER good bring you straight to CDG Etoile which apparently is a town, and many other places. The place are quiet yet is near to town. What more can you ask for when the room are clean and tidy, and housekeeping are flawless. Been a frequent traveller. This is probably the best paris hotel choice with budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for a city of small rooms”
Reviews.Author: fgon
Reviews.Content: Being from Southeast Asia, my wife and I are used to good value and good service from our hotels. Although we realize that reasonably priced hotels are hard to find in Paris, Hotel du Printemps came close to meeting our expectations of a Paris hotel. The room was understandably small but very clean and modern. The hotel's location was excellent, being a short walk from the Nation metro, a stop for four different metro lines as well as the RER A. To go to the Louvre, the Champs-Elysees, and Montmartre, no transfers are needed. The Marais is only four stops away. The receptionists are typically curt but they were very helpful when we needed help finding places to do our laundry and to store our cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Robertjanloose
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay in this Hotel, it was easy to find. The staff was very friendly and there is a relaxed atmosphere. The room was on the small side but that is in every Paris hotel. The bathroom looked nicely decorated. The bed was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “lovely clean hotel.....bit of the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: historyloverGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the Nation district of Paris. As my partner is a frequent working visitor to Paris and knows the city very well we found the hotel fairly easily. However, if I had been with a friend I am not convinced I would have found it as easily. We found all of the reception staff very pleasant and the hotel itself was modern and most important of all, very clean. Our room was small but vey tastefully furnished and comfortable, the shower and toilet area were spotless and the shower was easy to work and fairly powerful. On our first evening we went to the Irish pub which is near to the hotel. Very disappointing, nothing Irish about it at all and food expensive and not good. We ordered burgers to be very very welldone and got them with the blood running out. Ordered cafe au lait and got expresso. After that we went to a 'flunch' at Forum les Halles, near to the Pompadour Cente and found the food very good and inexpensive. This place is basically a self service cafeteria but was packed with people night and day. If you are like me and you like to 'people watch' this is the place to go............

Reviews.Title: “Praying to go back to the Printemps ... SOON :)”
Reviews.Author: aprilsheart
Reviews.Content: i can not say anything not to highlight a very meaningful experience we had at staying at the Printemps ... although, i relied only at TripaAvisor's reviews, i am grateful that my husband and i took the chance at this very charming boutique hotel and did not regret at the choice we made. prior to our arrival in the latter part of November, there was a transportation strike and i had to email the hotel and ask them about the situation in the area, and i was happy that they responded to my query immediately and was touched that they were expecting to see us on our confirmed date of arrival ... this efficient move from management affirmed that we indeed chose the right hotel to stay in. being newly renovated, it was nearly spotless as maintained by a very efficient and genteel housekeeping staff ... the front office personnel including the Manager were all accommodating and eager to answer our queries anything travel-related and even responded warmly to casual conversations ... it felt like we were vacationing in a relative's home rather than a hotel. the environment around the Printemps is safe and quiet ... as we got lost on our second night coming back from a day trip to Cologne, Germany, we never got paranoid at getting into any harm's way. but was praising God that there were very kind Parisians who guided us back to where the hotel was. likewise, it is flanked with many pastry shops with freshly baked breads and with a lot of "formaggio" choices, fresh fruit stores, restaurants of varied specialties and i must not forget to mention the good Asian restaurant around the corner that served authentic Chinese cuisine. the hotel may not be centrally located, but it is in between two metro stations (the Nation and Picpus Stations) where you can get to the must-see Parisian sites in a matter of minutes. if my husband and i were going to be given another chance by God to travel back to Paris, we definitely will go back to the Printemps without a second thought at all :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and style in a well connected spot”
Reviews.Author: Pheedelma
Reviews.Content: Very stylish, if compact, hotel in a quiet residential area. The room was on the small side, but big enough and comfortable enough for two people planning to get out and about. The decor was the right side of boutique. There were a number of good restaurants nearby and a choice of Metro stations, making it well connected and convenient. We were going to the Palais Omnisport which was a few stops away, but not in as attractive a quarter. The location worked well for getting into the centre as well as out to Bercy. Staff were friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; small rooms though”
Reviews.Author: amrotefa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good value for money compared to other expensive Paris hotels. Pros: -Modern clean rooms, although sometimes housekeeping did not empty the trash -Value for money -Location is OK in a residential area, with a well connected metro station nearby. But it is not in the touristic area. Cons: -Small rooms, very tight corridors -Metro is audible from the rooms, with slight vibration. But this is only a setback for extremely light sleepers. In general noise level is low and very acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “A Paris Revelation!”
Reviews.Author: rome-weary
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated hotel, very stylish, very clean, all personnel extremely professional and nice, off the beaten path, bus & métro a few steps away, rooms a tad small, but this is Paris, and at this price one cannot complain; excellent price/performance ratio, we will come back in springtime when the leaves have come out on boulevard Picpus! Oh, and we loved the soft rumble of the métro, reminds you of where you are.....

Reviews.Title: “As what the picture says”
Reviews.Author: mapleleaves08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite centrally located and near to metro. I find it quite convenient though we had a hard time looking for it initially as we are not familiar with the road names. Rooms were clean and cosy but a little small. Staff were pretty helpful and could speak English pretty well. I could use the wifi without problem so overall i enjoyed my stay. :)

Reviews.Title: “Small for a superior room”
Reviews.Author: JaniceNC0001
Reviews.Content: The wireless Internet did not work at all. Nice location and we enjoyed the decor and cleanliness of the hotel. Parking was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, small hotel away from touristy area.”
Reviews.Author: sneezytennis
Reviews.Content: Tucked away from touristy sites, small hotel....clean, updated. We had a triple room (130E)which was huge by Paris standards, very clean and modern. Breakfast (8 E each) was convenient and sufficient, nothing fancy. Most of the desk staff was extremely courteous and helpful, but one in particular was not. This person acted like we were bothering him every time we had a question. (Hey...you ARE working at a hotel desk, after all......it's kind of your job to answer the guests questions!). Breakfast staff were very efficient and polite. We ate at Chez Prosper near Nation Metro stop (good) and another one nearby (Cafe Dumas, I think)...(not good).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JimMaura
Reviews.Content: My brothers and I stayed in a triple room facing the street for two nights in October. The hotel is in a quiet residential area so traffic noise was not an issue. Our room, which was recently renovated, was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was standard size with a shower that had excellent pressure and plenty of hot water. The front desk staff, who all spoke English, were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is classified as 2-star and it is a fantastic value compared to other Paris hotels. If you are looking for a clean, safe, reasonably priced hotel in a nice area of Paris, you certainly will not be disappointed with Hotel du Printemps. The Picpus Metro station is about 200 yards from the hotel which will give you access to central Paris in 10-15 minutes. The neighborhood around the hotel has numerous restaurants and bakeries. We dined at Chen Pao, which is three doors down from the hotel, two nights in a row. The food and staff were fantastic and I highly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Huntinghouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and selected this hotel based on other reviews on Trip Advisor. What we liked about Printemps: Location -- easy access to Metro Nation stop, you could be at the Louvre in about 15 minutes without having to change trains. We liked being off the tourist track and in an area frequented more by locals. There were many decent cafes right near the hotel where you could get a typcial French meal at a half-way decent price. Loved the Casino grocery store. We stopped there almost everyday for water, snacks, etc. One Saturday, there is a typical Parisian market near the hotel with an amazing assortment of fruits, cheeses, meats, etc. You see all the old ladies and the families shopping for their grocers. Value -- I did feel like this was a decent value for the money, given that we were in Paris. The hotel is in a safe location, it's easy and fast to get to the tourist attractions, the hotel was clean and safe. We did get a larger room, but i was still small. The bed was shoved against a vey cold window and I had to pile blankets on my side of the bed to stay warm. However, it's Europe and you have to accept these things if you are staying at a non-American chain hotel. We were thrilled that the hotel offered free Wi-Fi, and also had a desktop computer with printer in the lobby that guests could ues free of charge. We were in Paris as the strike over the change to France's retirement age was getting hot. We were quite worried about being able to get to the airport for our flight home, as the roads were predicted to be clogged (they were) and it was uncertain whether trains would be running as scheduled and if gas would be available for the planes. The man who was at the front desk that night was very helpful in finding us a cab -- he called several companies and got us a cab to pick us up at 4:30 am. We beat the traffic jams and got to the airport -- there were people on our flight, including crew, who were not so lucky -- thanks to his help. The breafast they serve is not worth it,s o skip it and save your money. There are many bakeries and cafes in the area where you can get pastry and coffee. Another really nice thing about this hotel was that there is a National Car Rental office around the corner. We arrived by car and it was a snap to return it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cerdi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel a it far of from the main attractions in paris but very near the metro. Lots of restaurants and places to eat around the area, as well as supermarkets. The hotel es totally renovated, very cute and cozy, and there's nothing a traveller visiting Paris would miss.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for sightseeing Paris in a quiet and calm neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: pvobbink
Reviews.Content: We had room 1 on ground floor. Room was very spacious according to Paris' standards. Although the room was next to the patio and pretty close to the reception, it didn't annoy us. Hotel is recently renovated and is very clean. The breakfast is basic, but good value for money. Hotel offers free wifi, but was during our stay pretty slow. Hotel is located in a quiet and safe neighborhood; excellent for guests who like a good night rest. Hotel is close to two metro stations (Picpus, Nation) and takes you in no time to all attractions in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: fritzkd
Reviews.Content: Printemps is a the high end of 2-star hotels as far as the basic services in a room go. There's no mini bar though. Quite a few good restaurants are in range any our favorite was Amalfi about 5 doors down

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Boutique Hotel Close to the...”
Reviews.Author: ralf_Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Nice Little Boutique Hotel Close to the Nation Metro Station. Very friendly Staff! also Fluent in English. Parking garage right next to the hotel. Breakfast buffet is small but has everything you need. Our room was small but lovely. The hotel seems to have been renovated recently.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: BedBugsAreBad
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been recently remodeled, so it is in very good shape. There was a strong chemical smell in the room that I couldn't pin down as to whether it was fresh paint or something else. The bathroom is really small with zero counterspace, but for 2 nights, we were able to make do. Room was spotless and beds were extremely comfortable. Walls were a little thin, and we could hear an elevator from the building next door, but it didn't bother my sleep. The hotel is on a street and there's nowhere to pause and unload luggage if you have a car. You'd have to park in the parking garage down the street and lug it back. In terms of sightseeing, it's less than a 10 minute walk to the Place de Nation metro stop which offers access to the express A Line. (Less than 15 minute ride to Arc de Triomphe!) If you want to take a cab back at night though, it will run you almost 35 Euros. Staff was helpful in arranging for airport taxi. Overall, a great bargain for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet area of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TexasYorkielover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September and were very satisfied with the experience. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and most spoke English very well. The room was very small, but the beds were comfy. Flat screen tv and air conditioning were a plus. They went out of their way to help us, and even provided breakfast for us one morning when we came down too late and found the breakfast area being cleaned. The woman handling breakfast actually ran down to the boulangerie on the corner to get fresh croissants for us!! This hotel is perfectly located near the Picpus and Place de Nation metro stops. It's in a quiet location, away from the hustle and bustle of inner-city Paris. Yet it's easy to get wherever you want to go by metro.

Reviews.Title: “very good paris hotel, good value and great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: barb302
Reviews.Content: this is a fine residential hotel in a great neighborhood at a great price! it is convenient to the metro as well!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Clean Hotel in a Nice Residential Neighborhood in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SC070
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at Hotel du Printemps. It was quiet and close to the metro, where it could take you easily to the major sites in Paris. Close by are many restaurants, cafes, and stores. I enjoyed it because it didn't have the chaos that staying in the center would contain. Rooms are modern and very clean (but tiny, even for superior double), bed plush and soft, bathroom impeccable, breakfast good. Receptionists are super friendly and will go out of the way to help you or give you information.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice possible for a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: erikaski32
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this charming hotel. Though a little bit out of the center of the city, it's only a short walk to a main RER station (which is really convenient) and just around the corner from several bakeries and grocery stores. It's located in a beautiful and safe residential area that is off the main road and really quiet. Our room was on the small side, but since we weren't there most of the day anyway, it was just fine for us. The rooms were beautifully renovated and clean, and the free wi-fi throughout the hotel is a rare find in Europe. If you're looking for a tasteful, clean hotel that is convenient and won't break your bank, this is definitely the place for you. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Horsecat
Reviews.Content: I really couldn't praise this hotel more. The rooms are small, but very clean and comfortable and the air-conditioning is a big plus. It's really close to Nation and Picpus station and there are plenty of bakeries, cafes and places to eat but the avenue it is on is really quiet on a night. The staff are really friendly and helpful and make you feel really welcome. It's not in the centre of Paris but it takes no time at all to get there by train and I think you benefit greatly from being away from the more touristy areas. Will definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeryIlieva
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 3 days in this hotel in July, 2010. We travelled by car, so the location -close to Peripherique and the public parking just by the hotel made it very good choice for us. Metro station and RER station (so important when you plan a visit with the kids to Disneyland !) are close by. The area is residential, nice and quiet, and there are a lot of small restaurants around, some of them working late, even on Monday. The renovation in hotel has probably just ended and the room, bathroom, loby, stares, everything was nice and new, beautifuly decorated. The rooms are small, the bathroom even smaller and we still don't think the small curtain and no proper bath tub do the right thing, but that the way in France, I guess. Good air condition, no fridge (no place for it ), free wi-fi (ask at reception when check-in) helpfull staff. Didn't book a breakfast, had some croissant in a bakery on the corner (Picpus). Would come back to this hotel, combining good location, cosy style and reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “A great value for a pleasant trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: pl_lovers_8485
Reviews.Content: David and the staff at the hotel were very helpful before we even arrived. Upon arrival there were no problems and everything was very smooth, despite our late arrival. I particularly enjoy the fact that the hotel will hold the keys to the room each time you leave the hotel so that you do not need to carry them around as you enjoy Paris. There is someone at the front desk 24/7 that will give you your keys and attend to any questions etc. The location while I guess considered to be a short ride to all the main attractions, is just that. A 10 minute ride on the metro and you are in the epi-center of all that is Paris. The metro is literally only a 5 minute walk. SOME walking is just part of the EUROPEAN experience, we are Americans and we recognize that we don't need to jump into our car as soon as we walk outside the door. Take the metro, walk a little - it's part of the experience and it is very enjoyable! The short duration of both will give you the pleasant experience without the annoying factor of "ugh - too much walking/too much metro". Around the hotel there are several cafe's and restaurants all within a 5 minute walk, some even shorter! They are all very nice and from what we saw generally open pretty late (1130pm and even later in many cases). There is also a grocery store near the Nation metro, about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. It is called CASINO.... go there to pick up little snacks to enjoy your downtime in the hotel. There is also a great pastry shop right next door to the grocery store... PNB Paribas charges no fees for those customers that are Bank of America customers... a "bankomat"... ATM, is located near the Nation metro station. Ask kindly and im sure someone can point you in the right direction, or just check google maps. Again, a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The size of the room is like any other room in Paris, relatively small. This is not going to be a room the size of what any are used to with a Marriot and such, but the size of the room does not at all take away from the quality. The room is very well decorated and offers many nice features such as a LCD tv, and nicely finished bathroom. There is a public computer and printer in the lobby for those that dont bring their own laptop, or free wifi in your room if you have your own device. Our ONLY two complaints are as follow, and honestly, they are minor: 1) The wife would have liked a full lenght mirror somewhere in the room... perhaps on the wall where there is some space as you walk in. 2) At times the maids were a bit loud outside and you could hear doors opening and closing, moving around, etc, so it made it a bit difficult to sleep AT TIMES and we would periodically wake up. The sound isolation of the rooms is not the best, but it is OKAY. There was also what sounded like a metro going by every 5 minutes at times for a period for a few seconds, but i dont believe there is a metro under the hotel so I am uncertain what this random noise was. It was not present at all times. Aside from these 2 minor things, everything else was wonderful. We would definately come back to this hotel, and it should be rated high when one does a price to benefit analysis relative to other hotels in Paris, and even in the same area!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing litle charming hotel, completely renovated!!”
Reviews.Author: a86c
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located between the Nation and Picpus metro stations. It's about 10 min subway ride to the centre of Paris which is not much considering you won't find a better stay in Paris for this price! The rooms are very small but cosy and beautiful. They are also very clean, and comfortable and the bathroom, although really really tiny, is very well putted together and offers everything you need. I was there in June and the hotel was still in construction works so it was very dusty and noisy during the day but since we would leave the hotel in the morning and only go back at night, it wasn't a big problem. The staff is very nice and thoughtful. They made a mistake with our reservation but were fast to solve it and very nice about it. Don't think it happens often. There are lots of caffes, supermarkets and a lovely italian restaurant nearby. Overall, it's a great choice for staying in Paris if you are travelling on a budget but want a modern looking, comfortable and clean hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the outskirts of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh_Lassy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Du Printemps with my husband for 5 days in July, and I thought this was a lovely hotel. All of the hotel was clean and decorated to a high standard, and all of the staff were courteous and happy to help. Our French was not strong, and the staff were very understanding and happy to converse in English with us during the whole of the stay. On request from the reception, we obtained a password to access free WIFI, which was available throughout the whole of the hotel, and not just the lobby as we had previously thought, it was also a lot faster than we thought we would get from a free service so we were very happy with this. The room was a superior and the only thing we could fault was that it was a lot smaller than I would expect from hotels normally, but I am told that this is the norm in Paris and I have not marked them down for it. The breakfast was 8 Euro, but we did not take it. The hotel is located further out from the city centre, but it is so close to a major metro station (Nation) that getting around from A to B was no problem for us. The area itself is pretty quiet, we never had any problems getting a good nights sleep. There are cafés, bakers, other small businesses, and a small supermarket which we used a lot on our way to Nation. At the end of our stay we ended up having to stay in 2 other hotels due to a flight cancellation, both of which were more expensive and clearly far inferior. Apart from the fact that Printemps was a far more handsome hotel, it was the little touches- offering to look after our baggage after the checkout time, asking if we needed any other services before we leave the area made the hotel by far the best of the 3 we stayed in and I would not hesitate to book back into Hotel du Printemps if ever we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a tiny room”
Reviews.Author: christellefv
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel du Printemps to have a room with two single beds, as we were a bro and sis travelling together. The room, newly renovated, was tiny but it did have everything: two single beds, night tables, telephone, television, armoire, desk, chair and bathroom with shower. Amenities were not that great in the bathroom and we ran out of toilet paper once (the cleaner didn't leave an extra roll). The Internet worked nicely. Although my room was near the elevator (small and slow) we did not hear it too much. Staff were friendly, answering my questions. They also allowed us to leave our luggage there before check-in (we arrived early). They also pushed check-in time one hour ahead (13h instead of 14h) and asked the cleaner to do our room right away... Which was nice. At the time of our stay some renovations were still going on in the hallways/stairs. The area near the hotel is ok, we went to a nice nearby café for supper, Chez Prosper. There's also a supermarket not far away. We did not take the hotel's overpriced brekky but instead went to the bakery 2 minutes away for nice chocolate croissants!

Reviews.Title: “Just as good, if not better, the second time around.”
Reviews.Author: lguluv3eb
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly stands the test of time. After having stayed there w/ 1 other traveller 13 months ago, I decided to rebook for this summer's solo voyage. The 4th floor room I was given this time was very similar to the double I had from a year ago -- clean, small, modern -- but the bathrooms have been improved (no more shower curtains to deal with; just glass doors). What sells me on this hotel, above everything else, is the location: Picpus is an adorable neighborhood. Some well-meaning (but narrow-minded?) reviewers might use the phrase "different Paris" to describe the 12th arrondissement -- simply because it's not the heart of the city. But, in many ways, the area is as Parisian as you can get. There's a Casino supermarket around the corner, a Printemps department store just down the street, and plenty of boucheries, patisseries, boulangeries, fromageries, poissoneries to choose from. While Picpus is somewhat residential, it's not the kind of area that shuts down at 8 PM or leaves out-of-towners scrambling to find open dinner locations on Sunday night. Place de la Nation is home to countless cafés and restaurants/shops open until midnight or later. The Nation metro stop is incredibly convenient to the hotel and is an excellent hub, as it's served by no fewer than 4 different lines. I never had to make more than 1 transfer to get anywhere in the city! Champs-Elysées? Saint-Paul (the Marais)? Montparnasse? Pere Lachaise? All direct routes, no transfers needed. The front-desk staff were all welcoming, always up for a chat. Each of the 4-5 people I encountered at the desk spoke English well, but also indulged me when I preferred to speak French. The housekeeping staff, too, was quite reliable (thorough, consistently organizing my belongings [sometimes amusingly so, such as when I found all my shoes lined up neatly in the bathroom] without disturbing anything personal).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money--we wholeheartedly recommend it for a young couple on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: afinnst
Reviews.Content: Like many of you, I like doing a lot of research on hotel rooms so I can get the best value for the money. This hotel turned out to be perfect for the price. The rooms were clean albeit small but that didn't bother me at all. The staff was friendly and helped us out with a corkscrew for a bottle of wine. The location was not completely central, but in the middle of a nice, quiet neighborhood and very close to Nation Metro which is a big connecting station. Exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Kreely
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights as wanted somewhere not too expensive to explore Paris. Very good location.........2 metro stations within 2-4 mins walk and gets you to Paris within a short time. Also, the Nation station (4 mins walk) has a direct train to Disney Park which takes 30mins, so this was extremely convenient. The room is as expected of paris, but we stayed in the triple room so it was bigger. They said there would be a double bed but was really 2 single beds which kept on moving. Pros..........close to metro stations ..........quiet neighbourhood and cool environment ...........friendly staff and good service ............not as expensive as most paris hotels ...........free wi-fi Cons ..........very small lift, can only take 2-3 people. ...........no kettle or fridge in room (not surprising) ...........2 twin beds instead of one double bed .............there's ongoing renovation but didnt cause any problems at all. Overall, ill recommend the hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, far from the Center”
Reviews.Author: gennari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I statyed for 4 days and we had a great time. The hotel is small, kind of old fashion, but was clean (for me it is really, really necessary). The staff was very nice and helpfull. It os located near a subway station but far from the center so you need to be carefull with you schedule, because it take some time to reach the mais attractions, as it is necessary to chane trains for at least once. There are some restaurants near the hotel among other facilities (like drugstores)

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I looked for!”
Reviews.Author: Lina_Brasil
Reviews.Content: If I could, I would have stayed in a more central hotel, in Saint Germain de Pres or Quartier Latin. Unfortunatly, we are talking about Paris, so the hotels can be very expensive and very, very old! I'm alergic, so I can´t stand old carpets and mold curtains... I highly recommend Hotel du Printemps if you want reasonable price, clean room with no carpets and don´t mind spending time in the subway! PROS - Rooms were recently renovated. Everything new: wooden floor, decoration, bathroom, curtains, etc. - Confortable beds, air conditioning, shower with very hot water, hair drier, TV (with CNN, RAI, BBC, spanish channel), towels always dry. - Nice residencial neighborhood, quiet, with good restaurants, bars, markets, and street markets on weekends! Loved it! Althought we stayed in a room facing the street, we didn´t hear noise because of the double glassed window and because we stayed in a higher floor (4th). - Metro Nation is 5min walking from the hotel and has the red RER and other subway lines. CONS - We got the superior room, so it was a little bit more spacious, but don´t expect a big room. Also, in the inferior room I believe the bathroom is inside the room, with no doors separating (you probably should check it). - A big person can complain about the space in the shower, but for us it was fine. - The hotel is still under renovation (june 2010), so the lobby and some floors have paint drops, painters, etc, but we didn´t hear any noise in the night. - Also, the hotel is NOT central, so expect to spend at least 30min to get to a central turistic attraction (including walking, taking the subway, etc). You WILL get the subway everyday going out in the morning and coming back in the night. I didn´t mind because I was with my husband, the neighborhood looked safe, the sunset in may is only 10pm, and our touristic routine is leaving in the morning and only come back after dinner. We usually don´t go back to take showers and leave again to have dinner or go to a show. So the distance was not a problem to us!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tarby83
Reviews.Content: In the process of being fully refurbished, rooms are small but comfortable and everything you need when you're just sleeping there. Have Canal+ Sport so was nice to be able to watch the football in your room as well! Was there to do the marathon and slept very well; a quiet street and comfortable beds. Free internet downstairs as well which is nice as most hotels charge for it in the rooms instead.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel in a lovley area”
Reviews.Author: paisleylass12
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel a day ago for our trip to paris .It was very clean, friendly staff, a few minutes walk from metro.The room was small, but apparently all rooms in paris are.Great bathroom, with power shower, nice and hot. We also had a great view from out window in our room. We would reccommend this hotel to people who want to see paris, and experience its true culture. Area was lovley with loads of deli's shops, coffee shops and places to eat and drink. i do warn you tho, paris is really expensive, 4-8 euros for a coke, 7 euros for a beer and 15 euros for a cocktail. To eat a meal for 2 with 2 drinks ( soft drinks)each cost us 65 euro. However make use of the beautiful patisseries , the one down from the hotel was wonderful and lunch for 2 with a sandwich each and a cake and a can of juice 8 euro for two of us. be warned though.....in resturants chips as a side order are 4- 6 euro, rice and noodles 6 euro each !!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: supercourt
Reviews.Content: Taking a romantic minibreak to Paris can be rather difficult when you're on a budget! After a few weeks of scratching our heads, my partner and I finally located this darling little place. I'm always nervous of hotels in Paris as you often pay through the nose for very little, or worse yet: something dingy and dirty. It could be the location (the hotel is between Nation and Picpus on the metro) as it is a bit far out, but I was completely delighted by the value to standard ratio. The location, let's start there! Nation is on line 1, which is great, but as it is so far removed it isn't one quick stop on the metro to the Louvre or Champs Elysees, it's a few. The metro, however, is notoriously awesome in Paris and will get you anywhere quicklike. It's far, though, so prepare for fifteen minutes to city centre. It's directly on RER A, though, which is the direct train to Disney. Around the hotel are a good few bars and restaurants, but right now (March 2010), there is a lot of construction, which sort of mars the skyline. The hotel itself was under renovation, but to me that wasn't a problem. We stayed in the newly renovated room 20 and even though we were directly above a room being painted and fixed we were never woken up by work sounds, nor did we ever smell paint or other finishing. The workers when we walked down the stairs in the morning always said bonjour and waved, as well! The staff were warm and courteous.
