They took obvious delight in my poor French and my boyfriend's funny French accent, but they were helpful and really nice. The room was perfect for 82EUR. It was long and thin (interesting), but we had a perfect double bed, a small closet, a little desk, and telly. Honestly, we weren't in our room much, so it didn't matter, but if you're a "I need lots of space sort" you wouldn't like it. Just enough room on the side of the bed to the wall. Our window overlooked SARL Concorde, which was gorgeous. The bathroom was clean and modern with a super shower. Honestly, comfortable bed and clean? I'm sold. It was a great stay and I'd highly recommend Hotel du Printemps for ANYONE going to Paris. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ttperiard
Reviews.Content: Very good and well located hotel near Nacion Square. Pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and clean hotel, good location to travel by metro”
Reviews.Author: TOMELA
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in renovation at the time we stayed. The room was very clean, but the painting was still smelly and that made the first night unbearable. The next day we wanted to change the hotel, but the hotels in the same location were fully booked and we did not wanted to spent time in Paris looking for a hotel. The next days we got used to it. If it wasn't for the smelly painting of the room, the hotel is very nice, clean and good located (near Nation station, node for Metro and RER).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Tiergarten
Reviews.Content: I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for anyone spending a short time in Paris. The location, while not in the dead centre, is a short metro ride away, and the metro prices are extremely reasonable for tickets of one day or more. Nation itself is a quiet residential area, but with numerous boulangeries, markets, cafes and bars which offer a great Parisian feel, without central Parisian prices. The hotel itself is very small, but cosy, the floors creaked in the room but that added to the charm of the place. If/when I return to Paris, I'll certainly be choosing Hotel du Printemps again.

Reviews.Title: “TIdy hotel in excellent "hub" location”
Reviews.Author: lguluv3eb
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations, even for a value hotel. The renovated rooms were modern, clean, and comfortable. Hotel le Printemps proved to be an excellent "home base," as it is situated close to several Metro stops. However, we felt no need to flee the area every day: Picpus is a wonderful neighborhood in and of itself. Neither too busy or too quiet, with wonderful restaurants, cafes supermarkets, flea markets, and specialty shops (I could go on...).

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MichiganWinter
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was excellent, staff was kind helpful and spoke English. I traveled with my mom and we booked a pretty large room for 3 people although it was just the 2 off us and we are glad we did. Currently this hotel is renovating the rooms on the upper floor, it will be really nice once done. We got to take a peek. We did order the breakfast with the room and is was great and plenty of food. The location was across the street basically from the metro station (Picpus). Metro takes you every where in Paris. This hotel is not in the center of everything, but therefore it also is pretty quiet at night. There are some supermarkets, a post office, bakery, brasserie and a police station with in walking distance. This was just perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: wanderer079
Reviews.Content: A great location, quiet and safe area close to metro and RER, shops. Room small (no surprise in Paris), pleasant, well serviced and comfortable. Breakfast is good value at 7 Euro. The lift is small but it works! English spoken at the desk - staff courteous and efficient. Free internet. We would be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably priced, well located. Top value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Guyrob
Reviews.Content: We were three couples who stayed at this hotel from Oct 3rd to oct 6ih. We really enjoyed our stay and found the hotel clean, the rooms adequate while small in american ways. The staff was polite and very helpfull. The location was ideal to us since it is within walking distance (5 minutes) to the metro Nation (line 6). From there you are within 20 to 30 minutes from the main tourist site. Sure you could be a little bit closer 10 minutes maybe , but at what price? some people are quick to complain and disregard the value they get for the price they pay. I have no hesitation to recommend. The hotel is surrounded by restos and cafes and you always feel safe in the area. We found the Marco Polo resto to be excellent and good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good find”
Reviews.Author: BookGirl9
Reviews.Content: While researching for a hotel in Paris, we decided that you pretty much get what you pay for. We settled on this hotel because it had gotten pretty good reviews, plus it had an online reservation discount. Like most European hotels, the room was smallish and the lift was tiny and slow. But everything was very clean and the staff (who speak English if you ask nicely) were helpful. The only thing I thought was a little strange was that you have to leave your key at the desk when you leave. The location isn't great - the hotel is very close to the Nation stop, but to get anywhere except the Bastille you'll have to change lines. We spent 15-30 minutes each trip trying to get to the sights of Paris. Overall, though, the value was good and it was worth it to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: RalucaUngureanu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights with my friends. We booked a triple room + extra bed, which was on the second floor. The staff was kind and friendly, the breakfast was very French, the rooms were always tidied. The neighborhood is lovely, and peaceful, and Place de la Nation station offers direct access to many attractions in Paris. Even if it is not central, the parisian metro rides very often, so arriving at the Louvre or at Chatelet was not a problem at all. The residential zone of Nation has many nice cafes where you can feel the French atmosphere, and the Casino supermarket nearby was a true savior. I am planning a trip to Paris next year, and I will certainly come here again. Greetings from Romania!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TO-psych
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 nights after reading all the good reviews here, but I was really disappointed. - Location: not very central at all, the map on their website is skewed and makes it seem much closer to major sites. It's a long metro ride into the downtown core, so if I forgot something or needed to rest, going back to my room would be a pain. However, the good thing is that the area is less touristy and near some local cafes, bakeries and a supermarket. - Noise: I was in room 300, which faces the street and was quite noisy. also, they are doing construction on the 5th floor and they start drilling around 8 am. - Room: old and shabby (not shabby chic... just shabby), very outdated with stains on the carpet, tiny, and no character. Lumpy bed. I'm a medical student and the room reminded me of a hospital on-call room... bare minimum and not the sort of place that is relaxing to come back to after a day out. - Washrooms were okay, and clean. Except one day, I came back to the room to find black dust/soot all over the shower? Must have come from the drilling upstairs... Overall, I was disappointed and having traveled in other parts of Europe thought that the quality was quite low. But I've heard that in Paris, your money won't go far, so I guess this supports that idea. You get what you pay for, and in this case, that isn't very much.

Reviews.Title: “Not interested in have we there!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoJunior
Reviews.Content: I´ve made an online booking for 3 nights stay by their website, the site gave me a confirmation number but my credit card was never charged. I´ve sent 4 emails and 4 another questions via website form to confirm what happened and I was NEVER answered anyway. Obviously I canceled the reservation and choose another hotel. They must be rich enough in order to not answer to interested guests and also have a poor reservation system and staff. I´m wondering how could be my stay there. Never again! Don´t try this hotel, they don´t care about you!

Reviews.Title: “good basic hotel, be careful about the outside noise”
Reviews.Author: fotoflix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short hike from the Nation Metro station, a little further than I would have liked. What I didn't like is that I could hear the traffic from the street and there is a small park near by where vagrants live (one of which owns a dog who barks at night!). On the good side, I usually came back around 11:00pm and was dead tired, so the noise didn't bother me after a few nights. Had to call the USA, couldn't connect using the hotel phone, so I had to use a pay phone. Free WiFi for all visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy hotel, friendly staff, good breakfast perfectly placed for our needs, will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsKitty
Reviews.Content: We had a refurbished room at the back of the hotel with it's own little decked area & patio table & chairs so enjoyed the warm evenings, relaxing after a hard days sightseeing, consuming cheese, biscuits etc with beer from the supermarket & tea from the hotel (@ 1 euro 50 a cup (was a much better option to restaurant prices @ 3.75-4 euro's a cup!). Minor irritation was the noise of the metro, which must pass underneath very close by but not irritating enough to keep us awake! Very friendly staff. All we could ask for at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: kvaiknor
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised with this hotel. The rooms are super tiny, but for two people that was fine. It was very clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location, while not central, is very close to a major metro stop and is in a nice neighborhood itself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and friendly”
Reviews.Author: nordicguyparis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the metro and RER. It is clean and quiet. The staff was friendly. The rooms are very small... not exactly like the pictures. We paid extra to get a newly renovated room... which was lovely - but very small... but then everything is in Paris. On the up side there was a small semi private terrace outside the room. For Paris this is a great hotel. Good prices, clean rooms and good service. These are things that are not that easy to find in the city of lights.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaAMT123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last fall and I chose this hotel based on reviews on this site. It is indeed a basic hotel but the value for money cannot be beat. The staff were fantastic for restaurant recommendations and for helping us with such things as figuring out how and where to catch a train to Normandy for a tour I'd booked from home. We had several (awesome) meals at Cafe Dalou around the corner from the hotel. There was a grocery store nearby where we picked up snacks and drinks and there was a great bakery just down the road where we got our croissant fix daily. The Nation and Picpus stations were close and convenient as well making his hotel the perfect base. My parents were in the city at the same time and stayed in St. Germain. For five times the price their room had nicer furniture and that's about all I can say. The next time I'm lucky enough to find myself in Paris I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: nola_mike
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, because my wife was here on business--her company picked up the tab at a 400 euro/night holiday inn for the other nights. the cons: room was very small, maybe 12x12. there were only 2 plugs in the room, one being used for a fan and the other a tv. however, if you're looking for a clean, cheap place to stay, this is it. the area was nice, easily accessible. bed was comfy. there was a huge window that opened all the way in our room, though it was a bit noisy as it was facing the street. the staff was very pleasant and friendly. free wifi (holiday inn charged an extra 20 euro/day!). the holiday inn had a bigger room, bigger bathroom, safe and a/c. that's it. so for the money, this place was a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ronrush
Reviews.Content: Room is very basic but clean, but staff is helpful enough in lending me a thermos flask and boiled water for me. Receptionist was also patient enough to help me book a shuttle van to CDG on the day of my departure. The rates are very attractive and I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It's a small hotel, so don't expect VIP service. But you can be reassured that you will have a peaceful rest and free internet surfing at the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE WITH A REALLY KIND STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: sandaletto
Reviews.Content: I stayed in your hotel for 3 days with my husband and my personal opinion is really positive!! The room is comfortable, clean and the services excellent, every days we found clean towels! Regarding the breakfast....we are very satisfyed, nothing was missing, bread, marmelade, milk, coffee and a mountain of baguette and croissant! I can say the same about the position of the hotel, near the metro and the city centre. If you come back to Paris (I hope !!!) surely we'll find Hotel du Printemps again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Quebec
Reviews.Content: For around 70 euros, the room was nice and clean. Staff was helpful, I asked to change room because our first night was at the front of the hotel facing the street and it was a little bit noisy so we couldnt keep the window open. There was no problem switching room for one at the back and it was very calm (room 36). Location is not very exciting but close to the Picpus and Nation metro stations. Also close to bakery and restaurants. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: doanjo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located near the Picpus subway station. The room was ok in size with a very small bathroom. We did not pay the extra 7 euros for the breakfast but there is a bakery located a few doors down. The staff were friendly and helpful. There did not seem a large selection of restaurants nearby but with the Metro a block away, that was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: ckpolite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic, but came with all the amenities we needed for our short stay in Paris. The room was very small, but spotlessly clean. It was located on a quiet street with many bakeries and markets on the block. Great for having things in the room, snacks, breakfast, etc ...The hotel is also within a mins walk to the Picpus Metro line, which connects into many of the main Metro lines at Nation. This was definitely a major highlight for this hotel as it made travel into the city center very quick, easy and affordable. Front desk was very helpful and the internet workstation was very handy. There was on a couple of things that I was disappointed with. 1. the size of the shower - I am by no means a large person and I had just enough room to turn around in it before hitting one of the side walls. When bending over to reach for my shampoo, etc ... I often turned off the tap or moved the dail to change the temperature. A slight inconvenience to me, but could be a major problem for others. But it was spotlessly clean. 2. The lamps over the bed came just above the top of the pillow. I bumped my head a number of time, but they were useful for reading in bed. Overall a fantastic experience at the hotel as well as in Paris. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for your kindness.”
Reviews.Author: yamamoch
Reviews.Content: The room is comfortable. The people is kindness. The bus stop and the station is near here. I'd like to come back this hotel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brunoflinstone
Reviews.Content: we appreciated the cleaness of the room. we didn't appreciate at all the smell of fresh paint in the room. at the daily return we had to open the window to refresh the room. very good breakfast. very good staff. helpful and kindly. we stayed in the room number 2 for 6 nights. there was a noise from the "metropolitaine" but at the end of the day it was not a problem to rest. the room was not big. excellent place to stay for the connection to the metro line 1, 2, 6 and 9 and the RER to eurodisney. we have a great dinner in LE DALOU at place de la nation 30 tel 0143434138, good place not expensive to eat french.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hyperbole
Reviews.Content: My wife left for London for a short visit with her friends. I elected to stay at a budget hotel, The Hotel du Printemps, near the Picpus Metro Station. For 55 Euros a night I had a small bedroom with a shower and wash basin. I had my computer set up on a small table, and I was able to use the Hotel Wi-Fi quite easily. The toilet was down the hall, but that wasn't much of an inconvenience. I'm in my sixties, and I don't need lots of frills (although the room did have TV). Most people would probably want more amenities, but for a single traveller, who plans to be out all day, this is perfect. The staff speaks English, and all of the staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Titanole
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for two nights at the hotel. The main reason was the price and the location near the Nation Metro and RER station. I knew going in that the rooms would be small. It is Europe after all. That was okay. They were clean, although there was a bad sewer-type smell in one of the bathrooms the first day and a few ants crawling on the floor. And on the fifth floor the lights in the hall we out, leaving a dark corridor to navigate. But it is a two-star hotel with reasonable rates, so some things can be expected. The staff was courteous and we had no problem checking in or checking out. Everyone spoke English well enough for American tourists to get by. Also, the Boulevard de Picpus is off the beaten track enough to be fairly quiet. To be honest I was a little disappointed with the hotel overall, but not enough to be unhappy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Truly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ilikevienna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel 3 days when we discovered beauty of Paris and it was amazing! Staff was very helpful and even spoke ENGLISH and GERMAN!!!! (which is really unexpected in France :P) Room and hotel at all was clean and tidy, well "femme de chambre" did every day very good job! Hotel is in very close distance to Metro station "Nation" with great conection to the city centre - to the sightseeing, shopping, etc. (e.g. to Notre Dame it was just 20 min.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, average room”
Reviews.Author: cuppanukka
Reviews.Content: Very close to Metro line ('Nation' will get you to most places in Paris quickly), and the staff were great. I know little french and they were very courteous and helpful in english and french. Breakfast continental buffet had a good range of bread, croissants, yoghurts, ham, cereal etc. Room (a single with double bed) was clean but not exactly spacious (bed filled width of room). View out of large windows was onto street outside, which was quite pleasant and not too busy. Toilet facilities and shower worked perfectly well. No tea or coffee making facilities was a bit of a surprise (not sure if this is always the case in Paris), and rooms had quite thin walls so people in nearby rooms could be heard occasionally. Everything considered I enjoyed my time here and would recommend to a traveler on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but cheap for being Paris”
Reviews.Author: ivang3
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, we thought the room was very small. The room we booked was intended for two beds (smaller than twin size), but there were 3 of us travelers. The staff was real good about adding the third bed (same size), so we were glad we could find a place for 3 travelers. The room automatically became smaller than it already was :-) BUT we didn't book this particular room for space. We booked it because we wanted a safe, clean place to stay during our Paris vacation. This hotel was great for this! We pretty much used it to sleep/shower. One note: the elevator can only carry 3-4 people tops. Only 2 with a piece of luggage each. It's tiny (-: no big whoop...just take turns. A BIG plus of this hotel was that it was less than a block away from a Metro station. Even though the hotel itself was far from most of the attractions, it was VERY ACCESSIBLE to everything through the metro. You pretty much have to use the metro anyway to get around, so this was not a big deal at all. BIG PLUS for this. This station was called Picpus, and it was in Line 6, I believe. From here, you can get just about anywhere within minutes (you may need to jump on another subway). Either way, if you're visiting Paris you should buy a 7-day pass or so to get around everywhere efficiently :-) One minus of this hotel was that I couldn't find enough outlets to plug in my 3 cameras (video, still, SLR) + cell phone. An extension cord would've been nice, but I didn't bother asking for one. The staff was pretty good. We only needed to talk to them to pay (the price was exactly as advertised) and for directions once. We didn't eat breakfast there, since we wanted to explore and eat outside of the hotel. Overall it was a good value. I gave it 4/5 simply because of the space issue, which again to us was no big deal since we just wanted to sleep/shower there, but in comparison with the average hotel, this was just half a step behind.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jonnyfingers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2008 for 3 nights as part of a holiday traveling around northern France. I booked this hotel because of the price and its location close to Nation RER and Metro station. First things first, this is not a luxury hotel. The rooms are very small and pretty basic. We stayed in a double room with an en-suite bathroom. You get a bed, two tiny bedside tables, bedside lamps, a small desk, small wardrobe and TV. The en-suite was very compact, almost cubicle sized, but had a toilet, wash basin, mirror and a pretty good shower with plenty of hot water. But for the money, and especially in Paris, you get more than what you pay for. The front desk staff were a mixed bag. All spoke pretty good English and one girl was very nice. However one man was extremely rude. My girlfriend is fluent in French but he refused to speak to her in French, instead speaking in broken English. He seemed uninterested in working there and certainly wouldn't go out of his way to help. However I wouldn't use this as a reason to avoid the hotel. The lobby of the hotel is small but nice. The breakfast area is right in the lobby due to all the buildings being compact in Paris. We did not pay for breakfast any morning, instead choosing to get breakfast at some nearby shops or restaurants. Which brings me onto the location. The hotel is a 5 min walk from Nation metro station. Nation is a large roundabout with over 8 exits so finding which one to take is not easy. The street that the hotel is on is not actually one of the exits. The easiest way to find it is to look for the "Quik" fast-food restaurant. Walk past that and there will be a road veering to your right. That's Boulevard de Picpus and the hotel is a short way down that street. There is an excellent patisserie right on the corner between the Metro station and the hotel which has excellent pastries. There is also a "Casino" supermarket, some restaurants and a "Printemps" nearby. Because Nation is a little outside the center of Paris it really feels like you're in "real" Paris with very few tourists. However the Metro and RER station can take you anywhere you need to go in a short time. Getting to Central Paris is no problem. We also went to Disneyland Paris and the RER train goes straight to it from the Nation RER station. Lastly a nice touch in the hotel is a PC with free access to the Internet. This came in very handy when searching for some good restaurants. One I highly recommend is "Brasserie Bofinger" just a short walk from Bastille metro station. www.bofingerparis.com/ In summary for the money you pay this hotel is good value. Just don't expect luxury and you'll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: schnegge89
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Printemps was really very nice. We booked a double room with shared toilet for an amount of 55€ per night. So it was really cheap compared to other hotels in paris. The staff was very nice and tried to help every time we needed them. Breakfast was also ok, 7 € per person. The rooms were very clean and tidy, contained shower, sink (we really only had to share the toilet) and even a hairdryer. The hotel also provides free internet access, and there is an elevator. Each room is equipped with TV, you could even receive the german programmes RTL and MTV. So there was nothing we missed, although we must admit that our room was a little small indeed. It was estimatingly about..8 to 10 squaremeters.And I GUESS that we had a bed which was 1,40 meters wide.

Reviews.Title: “Paris free from tourists”
Reviews.Author: Fieryfred
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here over Christmas. The hotel is in a quiet street 5 minutes walk form the Nation metro station making it well placed to access all the major tourist sites ( Champs Elysees in 20 minutes) but as it was free of massive numbers of international tourists, you felt you were in a French city where real Parisians lived and worked Our double room was a little on the small side but was very clean, well insulated for both heat and noise and had a well appointed w.c./shower room. Towels changed daily/beds made etc. Buffet style breakfast was available in the small bar/dining area and was very good value provided you took ful advantage of what was on offer. Again the area for dining was quite small and it did result in people having to wait for spaces at busy times. However for the price compared with a two star nearer the centre this was very good value indeed and we would certainly use it again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Printemps Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Kattekop1
Reviews.Content: This is the most terrible hotel we have ever had. Very unfriendly personnel. We had made reservation for breakfast via their website, but we were not allowed to have breakfast. This reservation had "no value". Why the hell are you giving this possibility on you website then? We had to have our breakfast somewhere else. Rooms are very very small and so noisy. A lot of things are broken.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Quiet Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisterWombat
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel du Printemps, 80 Boulevard de Picpus, in Paris several times. It's a nice, small family type hotel in a quiet neighborhood, barely 100 meters from the Picpus stop on the Metro 6 line (direct to Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe). Always found it clean and comfortable, although smaller than US-style rooms of course and the price is very low for Paris, in the 60 Euro range. Even has free wi-fi although you often have to go to the lobby or resaurant to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location !!”
Reviews.Author: Willy2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at Hotel du Printemps last October for 5 nights. Location is excellent : - 8 minutes walk to Nation Metro Station - A Minimarket /Fruits in the corner - A delicious bakery shop at 3 minutes walk. - Dozens of restaurants within walking distance , from "Quick " fast food, to Italian, Japanese, Chinese, French, Thai, Baguettes, etc. Reception staff was very friendly all the time. I noticed 4 different persons at reception during my 5 days at the hotel, and all of them were very friendly always, speaking English and very supportive. I asked for a family room, which was actually a triple with an extra bed, which was surprisingly to me quite big . Nice decoration and confortable. Toilet and shower in the room were small but very clean. No noise from the street, and we could sleep quite well. Wireless internet in the room worked ok all the time. We did not have the breakfast at the hotel, as we prefered some of the local cafes in the area, but I noticed that had good demand. Overall good experience and I recommend it with no restrictions !

Reviews.Title: “Loved”
Reviews.Author: keeponjumping
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really good: very neet and comfortable. Stuff was very attentive. I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Printemps”
Reviews.Author: nurse53
Reviews.Content: great location, very helpful and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “A good base camp for the explorer!”
Reviews.Author: Angaria
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in exploring Paris, this hotel surely is a recommendation for a nice stay. The rooms are not too big, but convenient and clean. Most rooms seem to have a shower attached, which is of good quality and makes having a shower an enjoyable thought. Especially the lobby is mentionable too. It is a nice place too relax for a while in the evening, because it is really nicely arranged and illuminated. For the staff is to say they all seem to speak English quite well, which is helpful just in case your French isn't that good yet. They are friendly and helpful and the reception is manned 24h hours a day. The hotel itself is situated in a calm side street, only a few steps away from the 'Place de la Nation', where the next Metro-station will give you instant access to the city. There are some shops nearby, so buying some essentials for the night is no problem. Alltogether the hotel provides everything that is necessary for a comfortable stay and turns out to be a good base camp to explore the City - and it does it in a memorable way, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely”
Reviews.Author: dynecka
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, very nice stuff, great breakfast. Lovely hotel. When I visit Paris again, I will come back to hotel du Printemps.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: avanti43
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable and clean room. The bathroom shower had almost enough room to turn around in. For a 2 star hotel in Paris, you can't expect much more. I would stay there only because of the cost. Location is not easy to find but once you locate the hotel, it's convenient to the subway system.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: byrdinflyte
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Printemps for several days of our honeymoon in France, and really loved it. It's set in a great neighborhood (fantastic bakeries, nice cafes and restaurants, and SO conveniently accessible by metro and RER). The price was great, and the accommodations were very nice. The first room we stayed in was on the small side, but very comfortable. The second room we stayed in at the tail end of our trip was bigger, and also very nice. We stayed in rooms with wc and shower in the room, and they were very nice, though small. The hotel offers free internet access in the foyer, which is also very convenient. The front desk staff was very kind, friendly, and helpful. Although you might not think of it as the perfect romantic place for a honeymoon, we quite enjoyed it. It's the perfect place to stay for any trip to Paris, and we plan to go back as soon as we can!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Printemps
HotelInfo.Address: 80 Boulevard de Picpus, 75012 Paris, France
